feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: The daily wage calculator is a feature that automatically calculates and deducts daily pay for employees taking unpaid leave. It determines the appropriate salary reduction by dividing the total salary (basic plus allowance) by the number of actual working days in the month. The calculation accounts for public holidays by subtracting them from the working days total. Upon approval of an unpaid leave request, an automatic pay deduction is created and reflected on the payroll table. The feature supports both calendar days and working days leave policies.

job_to_be_done.content: Calculate and deduct daily pay for employees taking unpaid leave by determining the appropriate salary reduction based on the number of working or calendar days in the month.

Provide a flexible and customizable method for calculating daily wages to determine salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction amounts based on company-specific calculation bases and salary components.
To allow super admins to configure and customize leave encashment policies for end-of-service calculations by selecting salary components and calculation methods
To calculate and manage unpaid leave deductions on a daily basis for employee payroll, enabling deductions to be set off against the employee's monthly pay.
Adjust and calculate an employee's salary proportionally based on the actual days worked, affecting their first salary and end-of-service settlement

primary_personas.content: HR personnel and payroll administrators responsible for managing employee leave and salary calculations.
Superadmin, Payroll table managers, and transaction processors who configure and manage daily wage calculations.
Super admins responsible for payroll and HR settings configuration
Super Admins who configure leave policies and unpaid leave deduction calculations.

navigation_paths.content: Access the Daily Wage Calculator from Settings → Payroll → Daily Wage Calculation.
Access the Daily Wage Calculator via Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure
Settings → Leaves → Leave Policies → Add policy → Unpaid leave selection.

prerequisites.content: An approved unpaid leave request must exist before the daily wage calculator generates a pay deduction.
Company's public holiday calendar must be configured to accurately exclude weekends and public holidays when using the working days calculation base.
User must have super admin role to access and configure the Daily Wage Calculator settings
Access to Leave Settings and Leave Policies configuration area with Super Admin privileges.
Super admin role access; active payroll system with employee records

data_inputs_required.content: Employee's total salary (basic salary plus allowance), number of working days or calendar days in the month, and the number of approved unpaid leave days.

Selection of calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days) and selection of salary components to factor into calculations (basic salary, basic salary plus allowances, or allowances only).
Salary components selection (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), calculation method selection (calendar days, working days, or custom days), and eligible leave types for encashment configuration
Selection of calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances) and day calculation type (calendar days, working days, or custom days) when configuring unpaid leave deduction policy.
Selection of calculation basis: custom days, calendar days, or working days

outputs_results.content: Automatic pay deduction reflected on the payroll table and calculated daily pay rate used to deduct unpaid leave days from an employee's salary.
Calculated daily wage rates that are applied to salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction calculations.
Customized leave encashment policy configuration that affects end-of-service calculations and visibility of which eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten
Configured unpaid leave deduction calculation settings that determine how daily deductions are applied to monthly employee pay.
Updated salary calculations that proportionally adjust employee compensation based on selected calculation method; changes apply to all active (unpaid) amounts in the payroll table

procedures.content: Receive unpaid leave request, approve the leave request, determine the applicable leave policy (calendar or working days), calculate total working days, subtract public holidays from working days, calculate daily pay rate by dividing salary by actual working days, and generate the payroll deduction.

1. Navigate to Settings → Payroll → Daily Wage Calculation. 2. Select the calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days). 3. Choose salary components to include in the calculation. 4. System applies the daily wage calculation to salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deductions.

1. Access Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure; 2. Select salary components applicable to leave encashments (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances); 3. Choose calculation method (calendar days, working days, or custom days); 4. Configure individual leave types for end-of-service calculations

Navigate to Settings, select Leaves, go to Leave Policies, add a new policy, select the Unpaid leave option, choose a calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), and select a day calculation type (calendar days, working days, or custom days).

1. Navigate to Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation. 2. Select calculation basis (custom days, calendar days, or working days). 3. Save changes. 4. If payroll month is open with existing prorated salary transactions, reject those transactions and then save the new proration settings.

rules_limitations_constraints.content: Daily pay is calculated by dividing total salary (basic plus allowance) by the number of actual working days. The leave policy can be based on calendar days (e.g., 30 days) or working days (e.g., 22 days). Public holidays falling in the month must be deducted from the working days to arrive at actual working days used in the calculation.

Calendar days calculation uses the actual number of days in each month (e.g., 31 for January, 28 for February). Working days calculation excludes weekends and public holidays set up in the company's public holiday calendar. Custom days allows flexibility to set a fixed number of days per month (e.g., 30 days for UAE and KSA companies to comply with labor law). Only Superadmin, Payroll table managers, or transaction processors can select the calculation base.

Salary component options are limited to Basic Only or Basic + Allowances; calculation methods are limited to calendar days, working days, or custom days; configuration applies to eligible paid leave types only

Unpaid leave deductions must be calculated on a daily basis and set off against the employee's monthly pay. Multiple calculation method options are available (Basic Only, Basic + Allowances) and multiple day type options (calendar days, working days, custom days).

Changes to salary proration affect all active (unpaid) amounts in the payroll table. When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions are submitted for one or multiple employees, Super admin must reject the transactions before saving new proration settings.

edge_cases_warnings.content: Public holidays must be considered and subtracted from the total working days when calculating daily pay. For example, if two days are public holidays in a 22-day working month, the daily pay calculation uses 20 days instead of 22 days.

Calculation results vary depending on the selected calculation base and month length. Different calculation methods can significantly impact final wage calculations for salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deductions. Companies must ensure the selected calculation base aligns with applicable labor law requirements.
Super admins can see which eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten by the new Daily Wage Calculator configuration
Multiple options exist for daily rate calculation including Basic Only and Basic + Allowances, requiring careful selection based on organizational policy requirements.
When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions exist, Super admin must manually reject and resave transactions to apply new salary proration settings

feature_interactions_dependencies.content: The daily wage calculator interacts with the payroll system to automatically create and reflect pay deductions, and connects with leave management and employee record systems.

The Daily Wage Calculator interacts with payroll settings, the company's public holiday calendar configuration, and leave management systems to calculate accurate daily wage rates for salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deductions.
Interacts with Payroll settings, End of Service calculations, and Leave Management system to customize leave encashment policies
Interacts with the payroll system by calculating daily deductions that are applied to monthly employee pay; similar to leave encashment functionality.
Interacts with Payroll system, payroll table (active/unpaid amounts), and affects employee first salary and end-of-service settlement calculations

glossary_terms.content: Daily pay: The calculated daily salary rate used to deduct unpaid leave days, derived from dividing total salary by actual working days in the month. ; Actual working days: The number of working days in a month after deducting public holidays from the total working days. ; Unpaid leave: Leave taken by an employee without pay, which triggers an automatic salary deduction calculated using the daily wage calculator.

Calendar days: The total number of days in a given month (e.g., 31 days in January, 28 days in February). Working days: Only business days counted; weekends and public holidays are excluded. Custom days: A flexible calculation base set according to company policies, commonly used as 30 days in UAE and KSA to comply with labor law requirements.

Leave encashment: The process of converting unused leave into monetary compensation; End-of-service: Calculations performed when an employee exits the organization; Daily Wage Calculator: Tool for configuring leave encashment policies based on salary components and calculation methods

Unpaid leave: Leave taken by an employee without compensation; Daily rate calculation: The method used to compute daily deduction amounts based on salary components; Leave encashment: Similar feature for calculating leave value for payment purposes.

DWC (Daily Wage Calculator): System component for configuring salary proration calculation methods. Salary proration: Proportional adjustment of employee compensation based on actual days worked. Calculation bases: Methods for determining daily wage (custom days, calendar days, working days).
